alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Florence; Forest; Kewaunee; Langlade; Lincoln; Manitowoc; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Oneida; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Southern Marinette County; Southern Oconto County; Vilas; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 2:37AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION MOVING THROUGH THE AREA... At 220 am, radar indicated a large area of wintry precipitation across the entire area except for the northeast tip of the Door peninsula. The precipitation was falling as snow across central, north-central, and far northeast Wisconsin. Slightly warmer air over east-central was resulting in a rain/snow mix, with just rain occurring within 5 to 10 miles of Lake Michigan. The overall trend will be for snow to continue north and west of the Fox Valley. Precipitation in east-central Wisconsin will transition to mainly snow, and a rain/snow mix near the lakeshore. However, the area of heavy precipitation was moving through quicker than anticipated. That combined with the mixed precipitation in east-central Wisconsin will result in considerably less snow than initially expected there--only 1 to 3 inches away from Lake Michigan. Up to an inch or so of slushy snow could still accumulate near the lakeshore south of the Door Peninsula. In addition, temperatures remaining at or slightly above freezing will greatly reduce the amount of snow that accumulations on roads and sidewalks. Snowfall totals in central Wisconsin will also be lower than initially expected, probably 2 to 4 inches in most areas. The warmer temperatures will also reduce the likelihood that freezing drizzle will result in any glazing of outdoor surfaces once the snow diminishes. Temperatures will be just cold enough for roads to become snow or slush covered and slippery. Snowfall totals across the north may be a little lighter as well. But since the snow is expected to linger in that area much longer and temperatures were a bit colder, roads across the north will probably still be snow covered and slippery for the morning commute. Anyone traveling across the area early this morning should use extra caution and allow some extra time to reach their destination.
